test_cases.name: Successful Login and Creation of a Core Task
preconditions: User has a valid Email and Password.
The user is associated with a valid Company_Name.
The application is accessible at the Base_URL.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application base URL and wait for the login page to load.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid email address from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is entered into the email field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Continue' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The application proceeds to the password entry screen.

test_steps.action: Enter the corresponding valid password.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is entered into the password field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Login' button.
test_steps.expected_result: User is successfully authenticated and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Wait for the company selection page and click on the correct company name.
test_steps.expected_result: The company is selected and the user is navigated to the application dashboard.

test_steps.action: Click on the 'Action Items' menu item.
test_steps.expected_result: A submenu appears with a 'Tasks' option.

test_steps.action: Click on the 'Tasks' submenu option and wait for the Manage Tasks page to load.
test_steps.expected_result: The Manage Tasks page is displayed, showing a 'New Task' button.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button to open the task creation form.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is entered and accepted by the system.

test_steps.action: Click the date picker input field and enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format, then press ENTER.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is entered and accepted by the system.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully and the page begins to reload.

test_steps.action: Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is returned to the Manage Tasks page, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.

test_cases.name: Create Task with Individual Team Member Assignment
preconditions: User is logged in and is on the Manage Tasks page.
Team members with the specified email addresses exist in the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name and due date are entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Scroll down to the assignment section.
test_steps.expected_result: The assignment section with the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field is visible.

test_steps.action: For the first email address in 'Assigned_To': click the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field, enter the user email, wait for the autocomplete dropdown, and click the matching user option.
test_steps.expected_result: The autocomplete dropdown appears with the matching user, and the user is successfully selected and added to the assignment.

test_steps.action: For the second email address in 'Assigned_To': click the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field, enter the user email, wait for the autocomplete dropdown, and click the matching user option.
test_steps.expected_result: The autocomplete dropdown appears with the matching user, and the second user is successfully selected and added to the assignment.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully with the specified users assigned.

test_steps.action: Verify the user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_steps.expected_result: The Manage Tasks page is displayed, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.

test_cases.name: Create Task with Bulk Assignment ('Assign to all Users') and Priority Alignment
preconditions: User is logged in and is on the Manage Tasks page.
A Priority with the specified name already exists in the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name and due date are entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Locate the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox and click it.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is successfully selected.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the Priority alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Priorities' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The input field for Priority alignment is active.

test_steps.action: Enter the name of an existing priority from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown appears with matching priority options.

test_steps.action: Wait for the dropdown to populate and click the matching priority option to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified Priority is successfully selected and aligned with the task.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully with bulk assignment and priority alignment.

test_steps.action: Verify the user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_steps.expected_result: The Manage Tasks page is displayed, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.

test_cases.name: Create Task with Huddle Alignment and File Document Upload
preconditions: User is logged in and is on the Manage Tasks page.
A Huddle with the specified name already exists in the system.
The specified file exists at the configured 'File_Upload_Base_Path'.

test_data.Task_Name: Huddle Align and File Upload Task 04
test_data.Document_Description: Detailed report on Q4 performance metrics.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name and due date are entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the Huddle alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Huddles' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The input field for Huddle alignment is active.

test_steps.action: Enter the name of an existing huddle from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown appears with matching huddle options.

test_steps.action: Wait for the dropdown to populate and click the matching huddle option to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified Huddle is successfully selected and aligned with the task.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens successfully.

test_steps.action: In the document dialog, enter the 'Document_Name' and 'Document_Description'.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name and description are entered into their respective fields.

test_steps.action: Ensure the document type is 'File'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'File' document type is selected by default.

test_steps.action: Locate the hidden file input, make it visible, and send the full file path to it.
test_steps.expected_result: The file path is sent to the input element and the file begins to upload.

test_steps.action: Wait for the file to upload and click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The file is successfully uploaded, the dialog closes, and the document is attached to the task form.

test_steps.action: Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully with the Huddle alignment and document attachment.

test_steps.action: Verify the user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_steps.expected_result: The Manage Tasks page is displayed, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.

test_cases.name: Create Task with Link Document Attachment
preconditions: User is logged in and is on the Manage Tasks page.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name and due date are entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens successfully.

test_steps.action: In the document dialog, enter the 'Document_Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name is entered into its field.

test_steps.action: Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
test_steps.expected_result: The document type is successfully changed to 'Link', and a URL input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid URL in the 'Enter Link...' field.
test_steps.expected_result: The URL is entered into the link field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The link document is saved, the dialog closes, and the document is attached to the task form.

test_steps.action: Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully with the link document attached.

test_steps.action: Verify the user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_steps.expected_result: The Manage Tasks page is displayed, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.

test_cases.name: Data-Driven Creation of Multiple Tasks in a Single Session
preconditions: An external data file (e.g., Excel) exists with at least two rows of complete and valid test data.
The first row contains valid login credentials.
The user session can remain active for the duration of the test.

test_data.Data_Source: External file (e.g., Excel) with at least two valid task data rows.
test_data.Note: The first row must contain valid login credentials; subsequent rows do not require them.

test_steps.action: Execute the login and navigation steps for the first task in the data source.
test_steps.expected_result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the Manage Tasks page.

test_steps.action: Create the first task using the data from the first row of the external file.
test_steps.expected_result: The first task is created successfully, and the user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.

test_steps.action: Verify the system is on the Manage Tasks page by checking for the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' button is visible, confirming the user is on the correct page.

test_steps.action: For the second task in the data source, click the 'New Task' button directly without logging in again.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Create the second task using the data from the second row of the external file.
test_steps.expected_result: The second task is created successfully, and the user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.

test_steps.action: Repeat the task creation process for all subsequent tasks in the data source.
test_steps.expected_result: Each task from the external data source is created successfully in sequence within the same user session.

test_steps.action: After the last task is created, close the browser.
test_steps.expected_result: The test concludes successfully after creating all tasks.
